articles.title: WHO: More than 6,000 monkeypox cases reported, emergency meeting set - South China Morning Post
articles.description: About 80 per cent of cases are in Europe, but a lack of testing means there are likely to be many more cases going unreported, agency chief says.

articles.title: Beautiful Cosmic Creature Accelerates Particles From Head - SciTechDaily
articles.description: The European Space Agency’s XMM-Newton spacecraft has X-rayed this beautiful cosmic creature, known as the Manatee Nebula, pinpointing the location of unusual particle acceleration in its ‘head’. The Manatee Nebula, also known as W50, is thought to be a large…
articles.content:

articles.author: Harry Dempsey, David Sheppard
articles.title: Norway's government halts oil and gas strike - Financial Times
articles.description: State intervention eases fears over security of supply for UK and Europe
articles.content:
Norway’s government has intervened to end a strike by oil and gas workers that threatened to slash production at a time when Europe is scrambling for supplies to offset cuts to Russian output.

articles.title: Panama reports country's first monkeypox case - Reuters.com
articles.description: Panama registered its first case of monkeypox in a resident who was infected after being in contact with tourists from Europe, Panama's health ministry said Tuesday.
articles.content:
PANAMA CITY, July 5 (Reuters) - Panama registered its first case of monkeypox in a resident who was infected after being in contact with tourists from Europe, Panama's health ministry said Tuesday.
